HashChangeEvent.summary: The HashChangeEvent interface represents events that fire when the fragment identifier of the URL has changed.

remarks.para: The fragment identifier is the part of the URL that follows (and includes) the # symbol.

HashChangeEventHashChangeEvent.summary: The HashChangeEvent() constructor creates a new object, that is used by the event fired at the object when the fragment of the URL changes.

blockquote.para: A web developer doesn't typically need to call this constructor, as the browser creates these objects itself when firing events.

HashChangeEventNewURL.summary:
The newURL read-only property of the
interface returns the new URL to which the window is
navigating.

HashChangeEventOldURL.summary:
The oldURL read-only property of the
interface returns the previous URL from which the window
was navigated.
